alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 8:41AM CDT until June 08 at 11:41PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall received early this morning combined with elevated river levels will cause the river to rise above flood stage. Details are included below. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...From this morning to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 21.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 845 AM CDT.
